question.title: Docker Build Fails: "Failed to Resolve Metadata for maven:3.8.6-openjdk-21-jdk"
question.body:
I am trying to build a multi-stage Docker image for a Java Spring Boot application, using Maven (OpenJDK 21) to compile the code and OpenJDK 21 as the runtime environment.

My Dockerfile:

# Stage 1: Build the application
FROM maven:3.8.6-openjdk-21-jdk AS build
WORKDIR /home/app
COPY . /home/app
RUN mvn -f /home/app/pom.xml clean package

# Stage 2: Run the application
FROM openjdk:21-jdk
EXPOSE 5000
COPY --from=build /home/app/target/*.jar app.jar
ENTRYPOINT [ "sh", "-c", "java -jar /app.jar" ]

Problem When I run:

docker build -t my-app:v1 .

I get the following error:

ERROR: failed to solve: failed to resolve source metadata for 
docker.io/library/maven:3.8.6-openjdk-21-jdk

and

failed to resolve source metadata for docker.io/library/openjdk:21-jdk: not found

What I've Tried 1.Checking Docker Hub:

  • I couldnâ€™t find maven:3.8.6-openjdk-21-jdk on Docker Hub.
  • I also checked for openjdk:21-jdk, but it seems unavailable.

  1. Using docker search for available images:

    docker search maven

It lists Maven images, but not the 3.8.6-openjdk-21-jdk variant.

Questions

  1. Does maven:3.8.6-openjdk-21-jdk exist, or should I use an alternative?
  2. What is the correct OpenJDK 21 image to use in my Dockerfile?
  3. How can I properly set up my Dockerfile to use Java 21 without encountering these errors?

Environment

  • OS: Windows 11
  • Docker Version: 27.3.1
  • Maven Version: 3.8.1
  • Java Version: OpenJDK 21
